posts.post_content:
This was a common in the Gamma play test version of Magic. That's the one that says "Opponent Loses next turn" for those who care about History.  
  
The first time I played the owner of the shop I played at, it wasn't restricted, so he popped out like 7 of these things in 3 turns and I lost to a Prodigal Sorcerer.

posts.post_content: This and ancestral recall are the only power 9 cards that really jump out at me as being overpowered. (Before you start whining, yes, I KNOW that the moxes and black lotus are extremely overpowered, but on the surface they just seem like nice little boosts, rather than game-breaking cards.) This, however, just reeks of overpoweredness, giving you an extra card, an extra attack, an extra land drop and numerous other "Extras" over your opponent. I'm really wondering how it managed to make it through playtesting without being spotted as degenerate, lol.
posts.html:
